subject: RE: [junit] Including test cases with production code
msgSnippet: ... But Mike, don t you think this is a different beast altogether?  OpenSource should have the tests included because it fully expects the user to change the
messageBody:
> > Can someone explain why someone (i.e. a customer) would
> want to clutter
> > their storage or bandwith with test cases?
>
> >
>
> In general, if the customer is able to modify the
> application source
> code, then the test cases carry their weight. Examples
> include open
> source applications or products where the source code is
> the primary
> deliverable (e.g. frameworks).

But Mike, don't you think this is a different beast altogether? OpenSource
should have the tests included because it fully expects the user to change
the code. If the user is responsible about maintaining the tests then it
makes it easier for the progenitor(s) of the project accept changes to the
base code. At least in a somewhat perfect world... :D

-Jason
